cause.description:
At least 70 percent of people have suffered a traumatic event at least once in their lives.
Of them, 20% come to develop Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.
Trauma includes both human-induced traumas (i.e. rape) and mechanically induced traumas (natural disasters). People in the United States experience trauma from any of the following causes: Rape Severe Beating or Assault Other Sexual Assault Serious accident or injury Shooting or stabbing Unexpected death of family member Child's life-threatening illness Witness to killing or serious injury Natural disaster
People who have endured trauma deserve a chance to recover and develop a healthy way to cope with it.
1. Human induced trauma must end.
2. Sufferers of trauma deserve to acknowledge and process their pain.
3. Trauma sufferers deserve to find hope and gain skills to victoriously recover from their trauma.
cause.mission: promote the well-being and mental health of people who have suffered trauma.
cause.name: Healing Wounded Hearts
